39491619.review: without a tutorial and a scenario it's impossile to play.

39431188.review:
Very reminiscent of old Rollercoaster Tycoon games and a good spiritual successor that remains in the same type of look and feel of rct classic games.  While Planet Coaster is of course another spiritual successor of RCT games, with a more "modern feel" to it, Parkitect is more like a continuation of the classic games, which I mention so that if you're reading this review you can make a  decision based on what you're looking for.  

I have only played a short time so keep that in mind when you read this.  In my first hour of playing this and learning the ins and outs of it, having played all of the RCT games up to RCT3, the feel, the look and the mechanics of Parkitect was easy to pick up on and learn.  Definitely one that fills that urge to return to the old tycoon games, that's for sure.  It does the job very well.  You create the rides, place entrances, exits, test and open the rides as expected, add paths, shops, and your employees for keeping things running and clean.  They've added "haulers"  which is new, and shops will need to have them in order to have their products or raw materials (food) delivered to them in order to run.  I think this was a good idea for those super into micromanaging everything under the sun for your park. 

I am sure this game isn't for everyone as I pointed out some may be looking for something more modern, for which I recommend Planet Coaster but for all the others this is absolutely a must play game!

39367871.review: Highly reccomend this game, I've had hours of fun on it and its very addictive!

39113764.review: wish the graphics were better, can i ride these rides some day? VR maybe. DO IT

39023799.review:
Очень приятная игра, выполненная в духе RCT 1 и 2. Во многом современнее, красивее и гибче, чем игры-предшественники. Хорошо сделана экономика, есть много различных параметров, о которых стоит думать при застройке парка.

Хочется больше контента, как аттракционов, горок, так и элементов сценария, видов дорожек и т.д.!

С оптимизацией на данный момент все еще не очень хорошо, особенно это заметно, когда отдаляешь камеру.

Горки строить сложнее, чем в RCT, сложнее сводить их по высоте (больше уровней высоты и наклона, чем в RCT, вообще больше опций при строительстве горок), зато когда намучаешься и построишь хорошую горку - испытываешь настоящее удовольствие!

Из минусов - совсем нет сценариев и нельзя стартануть просто на рандомной карте. Частично компенсируется наличием сценариев в мастерской стима.

38921135.review:
great tycoon, fun to build in and i would even say it is better than planet coaster is some ways. if you liked RCT 1 &/or 2 then you will like this one. While there isn't a campaign yet and some parts of it feel lacking, the final version will surely have a plethra of rides to choose from, and due to its very very active development, that final version isnt far away. Just wait, you will be amazed.

8/10

38395858.review: I am not even a fan of amusement parks, but this game intrigued me because of the building possibilities - if you like building simulations, then definitely look into this game. The graphics are cute, there is great attention to detail, and you can spend hours designing and creating your own amusement park, and then "follow" guests around as they experience your park and enjoy the rides. The developers are also very responsive, the game is updated often and my only niggle is that it is quite CPU intensive, so make sure your computer is up to spec to run this game without any annoying stuttering, especially with larger park designs. All in all, this sucked up a good chunk of my time. I had to learn how to build and design things by watching a few videos on Youtube but after all that, the UI design is fairly intuitive. Would be handy to have an online guide (not video) to basic ride and building design though, as well as some tips and hints on how to best lay out a park... as well as basic instructions on storage depots, I had to learn all that via Youtube but it's simple enough to understand within a few minutes. Recommended for fans of building/strategy games.

38312452.review: This is fucking great. Immediaetly taken back to RCT1 & 2.

38286737.review:
Hallo zusammen, 

dies hier ist mein erstes Review. Wird also nicht so rund zu lesen sein. Also ich habe das Spiel noch vor dem Steam Release in einer sehr frühen Version über Hum*** Bun*** gekauft, und habe es bisher nicht bereut. Die Entwickler halten Ihre Versprechen ein und entwickeln das Spiel ständig weiter. Die Spielgrafik ist Geschmackssache und reicht natürlich nicht an ein Plan** Co*** heran. Das ist aber auch gar nicht der Anspruch der Entwickler. Hier liegt ganz klar der Wirtschaftsaspekt im Vordergrund. Und da hat es einiges mehr zu bieten. 

Positives
+ noch laufende Entwicklung, ständig neue Updates
+ sehr guter und fordender Wirtschaftsaspekt, dadurch angemessener Schwierigkeitsgrad
+ Achterbahneditor ist dem von RCT2/3 sehr ähnlich bietet aber mehr Freiräume
+ schon jetzt ausreichende Anzahl von Attraktionen
+ per Mods sind massig neue Attraktionen und Dekorationsmöglichkeiten vorhanden, aber natürlich auch Szenarien oder Vorlagen für Achterbahnen
+ realistische Warenversorgung der Shops
+ massig Möglichkeiten sich detailierte Statistiken über Besucher oder Attraktionen einzuholen

Negatives
- die Performance ist angesichts der doch recht einfachen Grafik noch ausbaufähig, reicht meiner Meinung nach aber aus
- bisher sind keine Besuchergruppen implentiert, die Besucher laufen einzeln durch den Park
- Shops sind schlecht zu individualisieren, hier könnte man mal bei Pla** Coa** abgucken
- kein Tag/Nacht Zyklus... was aber mit Sicherheit kommen wird?

Insgesamt eine ganz klare Kaufempfehlung für Leute die Freizeitparksimulationen mögen und sich mit der Grafik anfreunden können. Ich lege meine Hand dafür ins Feuer daß die Entwickler das Spiel nicht nur zu Ende bringen werden, sondern es auch wirklich in eine Richtung entwickeln werden, die sich die Community wünscht. Wer natürlich viel Wert auf realistische Grafik legt, dem sei ein anderes Produkt ans Herz gelegt, bei dem allerdings die Wirtschaftsaspekt ziemlich zu kurz kommt. Ich für meinen Teil aber mochte RCT2 sehr, Parkitect ist eine Neuauflage mit angemessener 3D Grafik.

Great "Pick Up And Play" Rollercoaster Tycoon esque game.
Build your own theme park, make your own rollercoasters, hire your staff and manage everything. The real old-school deal modernized and comes with mod support. If you like freedom and customizing everything this is 100% what you're looking for.

39647060.review:
Time of writing review roughly 5 hours in. 

Overview; Try this if you yearn for some old school RCT. At the moment I can't see anything that's too different, but game is constantly being updated by the looks of it, with a campaign mode to come in the full version. I'd like to point out I've not done much track, scenery or level designing. Will edit this if I can think of something else, or something gets added or changed! (Edited in line with developer feedback, who I'd also like to praise for swift response).

Pros so far;-
I like the addition of supply chains for shops (reminds me of Theme Park but not quite as infuriating as manually ordering stock)
-Staff rooms and staff training
-Employee Paths (the people get annoyed if there's people currently walking past with boxes...!)
-Queue paths, if you drag a queue it no longer automatically stops at the first 'normal path'. Minor but this was a big annoyance for me when planning things on RCT 1+2
-Ghost car when constructing tracks. No more saving, placing entrance, opening ride, testing and re-loading if something flies off the end ;)
-Mod community has made some pretty decent stuff so far, mainly scenery. There's a lot of blueprints floating around too.
-Guest insight. Market research is a great idea, plus detailed actions of all the things the guest has done recently.

Cons;
-Zoning for staff. Rectangle zoning feels clunky, able to edit a zone but very clunky.
-Track building can feel a little weird, can currently only edit track at the 'front' (annoying if you've made a mistake or want to tweak something as you have to bulldoze). 
-Rollercoaster types are nothing you haven't seen in other games.
-Not sure the guest needs balance is quite right, I noticed in scenario editor there's an option to say whether guests will be easily satisfied needs wise or not but in the general sandbox they seem to need drinks all the effin time pretty much forcing me in a more or less empty park to build drinks every 5 or 6 squares, which seems ludicrous to me. Interestingly they don't need the toilet often.

What I'd like to see;
Improvements in zoning. 
-For staff efficiency my mechanics are generally going to cover a larger zone than my handymen or haulers, being able to set individual zones by specific staff member different to the blanket zone, or for example be able to zone each type of staff individually (Handymen have their own zoning, mechanics their own, etc)
-Would be nice if a supply depot on the cusp of zone1 and 2 could serve both (with 1 hauler being set to zone 1, 1 hauler being set to zone 2). If this is implemented I don't think it worked.
-An option to select between brush zoning and rectangle zoning. I'm sorry, zoning is my main issue with the game as is.

Not having to only edit the coaster at the front of the track (very infuriating).

Ride cam
-Yes, there is a mod, but I think incorporating this would be a nice addition. It's the only part of RCT3 I enjoyed and can while away some time waiting for some cash to roll in.

Better reporting
Feel it can be much improved!

More rides, more shops, more, more! (I am assuming this one is a given).
